Of course, they excel at scorching flesh and bone as well.   Flame projectors are popular partially because of their wide and indiscriminate cone of fire, able to catch several individuals in a gout of flame. When triggering the weapon's Burn quality, the user may choose to apply it to any one target hit by the attack; this quality may be triggered multiple times, affecting a different target each time. However, the GM can spend 2 threat or 1 despair to apply the weapon's Burn quality to an ally hit by the original attack.  Models Include: Merr-Sonn C-22 Flame Carbine, Merr-Sonn CR-24 Flame Rifle.</description> <encumbrance>6</encumbrance> <hard_points>2</hard_points> <hp_required/> <name>Flame Projector</name> <number>GEAR0001017</number> <price>1000</price> <range>short</range> <rarity>6</rarity> <skill_used display_value="Ranged - Heavy (Ag)">d8a0d55cdbae88542901de90cf9619c0</skill_used> <soak/> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-11-02 15:07:01</sys_created_on> <sys_id>1a1762a82f10a450e0f497eef699b6db</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-11-02 15:07:01</sys_updated_on> <type>weapon</type> </x_176383_star_wars_gear> </record_update>
